featured.text: He determined that if he could recreate the same thing, making hooks-and-loops that bind to each other firmly, he could produce a strong fastener with many uses.
Upon closer examination, de Mestral observed that the burrs, which appeared straight to the naked eye, actually contained many small hooks that clung firmly to the loops in the fabric of his pants.
The ancient Egyptians believed firmly in life 16 death.

definition.en_def: In a strong, steady, or resolute manner.
definition.example: She held the rope firmly to prevent it from slipping.
